Value.label: Dim Level Memory
Value.Help: Using Last Dim Setting will bring the bulb back to the last dimness setting when turning on, instead of full brightness by default.

Value.label: Dim Level Memory
Value.Help: Using Last Dim Setting will bring the bulb back to the last dimness setting when turning on, instead of full brightness by default.

Value.label: Dim Level Memory
Value.Help: Using Last Dim Setting will bring the bulb back to the last dimness setting when turning on, instead of full brightness by default.

Value.label: LED Light
Value.Help: Sets when the LED on the switch is lit.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON, if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: Local Control Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Local Control Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: Invert switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Remote level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set remotely.

Value.label: Remote duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set remotely.

Value.label: Local level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set locally.

Value.label: Local duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set locally.

Value.label: Sensor Binary Report Toggle
Value.Help: Toggle the sensor binary report value when the Water Sensor is Triggered

Value.label: Wake Up on Power On
Value.Help: Enable wake up 10 minutes when the power is switched on.

Value.label: Basic Set Toggle
Value.Help: Toggle the basic set value when the Water Sensor is Triggered

Value.label: Report Type to Send
Value.Help: To set which command will be sent to the associated nodes when the Water Sensor is triggered. Bitsets: 1 -> Battery 4 -> Sensor Binary 8 -> Basic Set 12 -> Alarm Default setting: 0x100 (Basic Set) OZW Ideal Setting: 0x1011 (Battery, Sensor Binary Report, Alarm)

Value.label: Reset to default
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults.

Value.label: Sensor Binary Report Toggle
Value.Help: Toggle the sensor binary report value when the Water Sensor is Triggered

Value.label: Wake Up on Power On
Value.Help: Enable wake up 10 minutes when the power is switched on.

Value.label: Basic Set Toggle
Value.Help: Toggle the basic set value when the Water Sensor is Triggered

Value.label: Report Type to Send
Value.Help: To set which command will be sent to the associated nodes when the Water Sensor is triggered. Bitsets: 1 -> Battery 4 -> Sensor Binary 8 -> Basic Set 12 -> Alarm Default setting: 0x100 (Basic Set) OZW Ideal Setting: 0x1011 (Battery, Sensor Binary Report, Alarm)

Value.label: Reset to default
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults.

Value.label: Notification type
Value.Help: Set Notification type.

Value.label: Led indication
Value.Help: Set Led indication.

Value.label: Notification type
Value.Help: Set Notification type.

Value.label: Led indication
Value.Help: Set Led indication.

Value.label: Temperature Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: The Temperature Reporting Threshold Configuration Set Command sets the reporting threshold for changes in the ambient temperature as detected by the thermostat.

Value.label: HVAC Settings
Value.Help: Read-only parameter 0 - 7 -> HVAC Setup: Normal (0x01) or Heat Pump (0x02) 8 - 11 -> Number of Auxiliary Stages (Heat Pump) / Number of Heat Stages (Normal) 12 - 15 -> Aux Setup: Gas (0x01) or Electric (0x02) 16 - 23 -> Number of Heat Pump Stages 24 - 31 -> Number of Cool Stages

Value.label: Utility Lock
Value.Help: The Utility Lock Configuration Set command enables or disables the utility lock. If the utility lock is enabled, the setpoint cannot be modified directly via the thermostat screen.

Value.label: C-Wire/Battery Status
Value.Help: Read-only parameter 1 -> C-Wire 2 -> Battery

Value.label: Humidity Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: The Temperature Reporting Threshold Configuration Set Command sets the reporting threshold for changes in the ambient temperature as detected by the thermostat.

Value.label: Auxiliary/Emergency heat
Value.Help: The Auxiliary/Emergency configuration command enables or disables auxiliary / emergency heating in the thermostat. Auxiliary / emergency heating is only available if the thermostat is configured in heat pump mode and with at least one stage of auxiliary heating. This command enables auxiliary / emergency heating when the thermostat is in Auto mode. The Thermostat Set Mode command with mode Auxiliary/Emergency Heat will enable emergency heating but only if the thermostat is in Heat mode. This command should only be used on thermsotats that support Auxiliary/Emergency Heat thermostat mode.

Value.label: Thermostat Swing Temperature
Value.Help: The Auxiliary/Emergency configuration command enables or disables auxiliary/emergency heating in the thermostat. Auxiliary/emergency heating is only available if the thermostat is configured in heat pump mode and with at least one stage of auxiliary heating. This command enables auxiliary / emergency heating when the thermostat is in Auto mode. The Thermostat Set Mode command with mode Auxiliary/Emergency Heat will enable emergency heating but only if the thermostat is in Heat mode. This command should only be used on thermsotats that support Auxiliary/Emergency Heat thermostat mode.

Value.label: Thermostat Diff Temperature
Value.Help: The Thermostat Differential Temperature configuration command sets the differential temperature for multi-stage HVAC systems. The differential temperature delta defines when the thermostat will turn on additional stages. There are two differential temperatures, one for multistage cool systems and one for multistage heat systems. If the thermostat is not configured for multistage HVAC systems then these parameters have no effect.

Value.label: Thermostat Recovery Mode
Value.Help: The Thermostat Recovery Mode configuration command sets the HVAC recovery mode type. The recovery mode determines when additional HVAC stages are turned off as the ambient temperature returns to the target temperature. If the recovery mode is set to economy, the thermostat will turn off additional HVAC stages when the ambient temperature reaches the target temperature plus/minus the differential temperature. If the recovery mode is set to fast, the thermostat will leave all stages on (assuming they were already on) until the ambient temperature reaches the target temperature.

Value.label: Temperature Reporting Filter
Value.Help: The Temperature Reporting Filter configuration command sets upper and lower bounds of the ambient temperature reporting. The thermostat will not report ambient temperature changes if the ambient temperature falls between these bounds. For example, if the upper bound is 80F and the lower bound is 60F, the thermostat will not send SENSOR_MULTI_LEVEL_REPORTS for ambient temperature values between 60F and 80F. The thermostat will only send ambient temperature changes if the thermostat has been added to an association group (see Command Class Association) and the temperature reporting threshold is non-zero (see Temperature Reporting Threshold).
